department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: Request for Standing Offer for Automotive Engine Repair Services for CFB Trenton.
description: The Government of Canada is seeking a contractor to provide automative engine repair services for CFB Trenton through a standing offer agreement
full_summary:
### Automotive Engine Repair Services for CFB Trenton

#### Solicitation Details

*   Solicitation Number: WS4074909462
*   Solicitation Reference: [WS4074909462-Doc4204125019](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17399974?extsite=MTczOTk5NzRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)
*   Publication Date: September 8, 2023
*   Tender Closing Date: October 4, 2023 2:00:00 PM
*   Catalogue Number: 78181500

#### Service Description

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is seeking a contractor to provide automotive engine repair services for CFB Trenton.

#### Key Details

*   The contract is expected to begin on or about November 1, 2023, and will run until October 31, 2026.
*   The scope of work includes the repair and replacement of various types of automotive engines.
*   The contractor will be required to submit a price in Canadian dollars.
*   The contract will be awarded based on a competitive bid process.

#### Contact Information

*   Name: Crystal Denton
*   Email: crystal.denton@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
*   Note: No phone or fax information is provided.

#### Trade Agreements and Region

*   This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
*   The region of opportunity is Quinte West. 

#### Bidders' Requirements

*   The bidder must have the necessary qualifications and experience to undertake the work.
*   The bidder must also be able to meet the requirements of the CFTA.
*   The bidder's bid must be completed in accordance with the instructions provided.
*   The bidder must be able to demonstrate a thorough understanding of the work to be performed. The bidder's bid must also include all necessary documentation and certifications.

Note: It is the responsibility of the bidder to ensure that they meet all the requirements outlined in the tender package. The bidder must also review the tender package carefully to ensure that they do not inadvertently submit a bid that contains errors or inadequacies. The successful bidder will be required to sign the contract and comply with the terms and conditions outlined within. The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) and the Department of National Defence (DND) are not responsible for any inaccuracies
